Module com.example.battleship
Package com.example.battleship.Model.Ship

Interface IShip

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AircraftCarrier, Destroyer, Frigate, ShipAdapter, Submarine
public interface IShip extends Serializable
Interface describing a ship placed on the board. Implementations expose position, direction, size and hit tracking.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    IShip.Direction
    Cardinal directions used for ship placement and iteration.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getCol()
    Returns the base column (x) where the ship was placed.
    IShip.Direction
    getDirection()
    Returns the placement direction for the ship.
    int
    getHitCount()
    Returns the number of registered hits this ship currently has.
    int
    getRow()
    Returns the base row (y) where the ship was placed.
    int
    getShipSize()
    Returns the size (number of cells) occupied by the ship.
    boolean
    isSunken()
    Returns whether the ship has been sunk (enough hits recorded).
    void
    registerHit()
    Registers a hit against the ship.

  • Method Details

    • isSunken

      boolean isSunken()
      Returns whether the ship has been sunk (enough hits recorded).
      Returns:
      true if sunken

    • registerHit

      void registerHit()
      Registers a hit against the ship. Implementations should update internal hit counters.

    • getRow

      int getRow()
      Returns the base row (y) where the ship was placed. Coordinates are 1-based.
      Returns:
      base row (y)

    • getCol

      int getCol()
      Returns the base column (x) where the ship was placed. Coordinates are 1-based.
      Returns:
      base column (x)

    • getShipSize

      int getShipSize()
      Returns the size (number of cells) occupied by the ship.
      Returns:
      ship size in cells

    • getDirection

      IShip.Direction getDirection()
      Returns the placement direction for the ship.
      Returns:
      Direction enum value

    • getHitCount

      int getHitCount()
      Returns the number of registered hits this ship currently has.
      Returns:
      hit count
